newsitem.title: USA: Oracle tops '96 database market - Dataquest.
newsitem.headline: Oracle tops '96 database market - Dataquest.

text.p: Oracle Corp was the top vendor in the global database market in 1996 with 30 percent market share, according to a Dataquest study.
International Business Machines Corp was in second place with 26 percent market share, followed by Informix Corp, Dataquest said.

Driven by the strong growth in the relational database management system (RDBMS) market, the worldwide database market grew 15 percent in 1996, reaching revenues of $5.7 billion compared to $4.9 billion in 1995, the study said.
Dataquest, a market research company that is part of Gartner Group, said the report is offered as part of its Client/Server Software Worldwide program.

The report predicts that the database market will reach $10.1 billion in the year 2001, with most of the revenue coming from RDBMS products and with UNIX, the platform for half of the overall revenue base.

"The emergence of the Universal Server has prompted renewed activity in the RDBMS market, which has benefited all participating vendors," said Carolyn DiCenzo, director of Dataquest's client/server software program.

Dataquest said Oracle posted 1996 database revenues of $1.70 billion. IBM posted $1.46 billion and Informix reported $527 million. All the other, unnamed vendors accounted for $2.01 billion in revenues, the report said.
